upcoming.title: To Be Here
upcoming.description: Exploring the effects of physically degenerative illnesses on mental health, TO BE HERE follows Daisy, a young woman who has watched her father, Benjie, cope with progressive physical deterioration for many years. Now that Benjie has reached the last stage of his illness, he and Daisy work together to reconcile their shared experiences versus how they hope to remember one another as they are confronted with the limit that time imposes.

upcoming.description: Halloween. The best time of year for pumpkins, candy, tricks, and... murder? The horror gets all too real when three friends discover a dead burglar in their front hallway. Truths are revealed and friendships are tested, but nothing can prepare the trio for the night that awaits them...

reviews.name: Peter Filichia
reviews.person_information: NYC theater critic/ Host of annual Theatre World Awards
reviews.description: At intermission, I corralled Unger to say how thrilled I was thus far. "And that kid playing Ben Franklin!" I exuded. "You must have been so thrilled the moment he walked through the door!" "SHE," he corrected. And indeed the program revealed that a Melissa Shohet was playing ol' Ben. The excellent performer could have fooled me - and did.

reviews.name: Cloteal L. Horne
reviews.description: It is the mark of a wonderful artist when they can etch out a role and give it full humanity, and you did that with Sorin. Your physical work communicated an extraordinary amount of information, and you anchored this scene in honest and liberating ways.

reviews.name: Dylan Kwang
reviews.description: Melissa Shohet stole almost every scene. Her hilariously dramatic account of the Baskerville curse had the audience in stitches.
